Reviews.Title: “Lots of choices, don't pick this one!”
Reviews.Author: HollynannaArizona
Reviews.Content: We travel to Phoenix regularly, and have good luck with the less expensive motels. However, this one time was horrible! Going to a concert, so wanted a close-by motel, but never again! The lobby stinks, the room stinks. Cockroach in the bathtub. Dirty bathroom door. Beds a joke, so hard & uncomfortable! Flat, not fitted sheets, you know how they come undone the first time you turn over! Light bulbs missing. Stains on carpet and one chair (broken too). T.V. channels didn't work. Curtain broken. Desk clerk didn't mention "free breakfast", but by morning I would not have trusted the cleanliness of that either! UGH UGH.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Meg_baca512
Reviews.Content: They don't care about customer service at all! Our flight was delayed so we didn't land until around midnight. Called the hotel and they said they would come pick us up. An hour later and 2 phone calls saying "we're on our way" and then just no answer at all we showed up at the hotel. The front door was locked and we had to call and bang on the door for around 15 minutes before the guy sleeping in the back (which we could see the whole time) let us in. What kind of service is that!!!! Rooms are gross and breakfast is only from 7-8. I would never ever ever recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ok For 1 Night”
Reviews.Author: Jordan0501
Reviews.Content: Neighborhood isn't the greatest, but if you're looking for a place just coming from/or leaving early from PHX then it's a reasonable option. Room was clean, bed was ok. It's not a vacation spot but it worked for the night.

Reviews.Title: “About average for what it is... a cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: yayhasplz
Reviews.Content: I came in on a late night flight and needed somewhere to stay until I could move to a nicer place across town. At $45/night I didn't expect much. My room was clean except for a crusty stain on the floor, and did not smell. Shower was hot with good pressure, and the bed was decent. NOT in a good neighborhood, but I had no car to worry about and I felt safe as long as I did not wander off down the street. I am a single lady travelling alone, and it was fine. No luxuries here, but I saw no bugs and felt that it was a decent value considering the nicer hotels were three times the price. I plan to stay there again when I return to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap.”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth1961
Reviews.Content: I was here on an incoming and an outgoing flight. Very good price for what you get. The room was very clean. The lady at the frontdesk very helpfull. Wireless Internet didn't work all the time but she gave me a cable and that was perfect. Breakfast is standard and included in the price and you can use a computer at the frontdesk if you didn't bring one of your own. The area is not the best one but yeah...what do you expect in Phoenix near the airport. I am a woman who travels alone and I haven't been afraid for a moment. I don't dwell the street at night though, not here. Good hotel to stay an overnight on your way to somewhere else. Clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Bad area of town”
Reviews.Author: adamchand
Reviews.Content: This was a budget hotel in all respects.No clock in the room,or coffeemaker.Was next to a junkyard.Its very industrial,near strip clubs and hookers.i wouldnt stay there again. The breakfast was bear bones. The shuttle was fine.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 3307 East Van Buren Street, Phoenix, AZ 85008
